Description: 19 beads of different shape and material. A: Three large and thin disc-shaped beads with a rounded edge made of turquoise faience in a low quality. B: Six segmented cylindrical beads made of turquoise faience. C: One small bead with a square section in an elongated rectangular shape made of vivid dark blue glass. The section shows a white glass filament framed by blue glass. Very smooth and shiny. D: Five extended sphere beads, three made of turquoise glass, two made of turquoise faience, one of them broken. E: One disc-shaped bead, flat, with sharp edges, made of white faience. F: Three small disc-shaped beads two made of turquoise faience and one made of ostrich eggshell.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
